note.p: Education: King's College, Aberdeen. MA; LLD (1855, Aberdeen)

Career: Entered his brother's counting house, London (1841); published 'History of Physical Astronomy' (1852); attended lectures in Paris; worked at the Royal Observatory, Greenwich; Regius Professor of Astronomy, University of Glasgow (1859); Director, Glasgow Observatory
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc 1894-1895 vol 57 pp i-iii signed by E J S
